And there was that in his face, as he spoke, which chilled the wildest, and left them well content to keep to the good claret and the saft seat, and let the daft laird go his own ways.

verbs.description: ploy (third-person singular simple present ploys, present participle ploying, simple past and past participle ployed)

entries.meaning: (military) To form a column from a line of troops on some designated subdivision.
examples: Troops drawn up so as to show an extended front, with slight depth, are said to be deployed; when the depth is considerable and the front comparatively small, they are said to be in ployed formation.
